content_strategy.stage_context: Pre-revenue, 1 user, 0 paying. At this stage, content should serve ONE purpose: start conversations with barbers. No thought leadership. No SEO plays. No brand building. Pure demand-gen through demonstrating the product in formats barbers consume.
content_strategy.weekly_cadence: 3-4 pieces per week maximum. Short-form only. All content should take <30 minutes to produce.

content_suggestions.topic: 10-second client booking demo — 'This is what your clients see when they book with Timber. No app. No signup.'
content_suggestions.why_this: This is Timber's one differentiator. Instagram Reels is the native format for barbers. A 10-second screen recording showing the frictionless booking experience is the most compelling proof point.

expected_outcome.reach: 50-500 views per Reel initially (new account, zero followers)
expected_outcome.conversion: Won't convert directly — builds awareness and gives you something to share in DMs and Facebook groups
expected_outcome.timeline: First 2-4 weeks will be crickets. Consistency matters more than any single post.
expected_outcome.compound_effect: After 20+ Reels, the account becomes a portfolio of product proof. When you DM a barber, they can see the product working.

distribution.cross_post: TikTok (same video, different account), Facebook barber groups (where relevant)

content_suggestions.effort: 20 minutes per Reel (screen record + text overlay + post)

content_suggestions.topic: Value-first posts in barber groups: 'How I helped a barber reduce no-shows by 40% — here's exactly what we did'
content_suggestions.why_this: Facebook barber groups are where software decisions happen. But you can't pitch — you have to provide value first. Share actionable tips about reducing no-shows (with or without Timber) and let barbers come to you.

expected_outcome.reach: 200-2,000 per post depending on group size and engagement
expected_outcome.conversion: 1-3 DMs per high-quality post asking 'what tool do you use?'
expected_outcome.timeline: 2-3 weeks of helpful posting before anyone trusts you enough to ask
expected_outcome.compound_effect: After 4-6 weeks, you become 'the booking guy' in 2-3 groups. That's a pipeline.

distribution.primary: Facebook barber groups (Barber Nation, Barbers Talk, Booth Renters & Suite Owners)
distribution.notes: DO NOT cross-post the same content to multiple groups — each group has different norms

content_suggestions.effort: 30 minutes per post (including reading group context and tailoring)

content_suggestions.topic: Side-by-side comparison: 'Booking through Booksy (15 steps) vs Timber (3 steps)' — client perspective
content_suggestions.why_this: Barbers don't care about features — they care about their clients' experience. Showing the client journey side-by-side makes the differentiator visceral and shareable.

expected_outcome.reach: If shared in Facebook groups, could reach 1,000+ barbers. Comparison content performs well.
expected_outcome.conversion: Direct — barbers who see their clients struggling will want to try Timber
expected_outcome.timeline: Immediate impact when shared in the right group
expected_outcome.compound_effect: Becomes a reusable sales asset for DMs, emails, and in-person demos

distribution.notes: Be respectful of Booksy — compare the process, don't trash-talk

content_suggestions.topic: Simple no-show reduction tips that don't require any software: text reminders, deposit policies, rebooking at checkout
content_suggestions.why_this: Establishes credibility without selling anything. Barbers' #1 pain is no-shows. If you help them with that, they'll trust you when you eventually mention Timber.

expected_outcome.reach: High engagement in barber groups — no-shows is a universally hated topic
expected_outcome.conversion: Indirect — builds trust and name recognition
expected_outcome.compound_effect: Positions you as 'the person who understands barber business problems' not 'another SaaS person pitching'

distribution.notes: Genuinely help. Do NOT make this a pitch for Timber.

content_suggestions.topic: Product Hunt launch: 'Timber — Barber booking where clients don't need an app'
content_suggestions.why_this: PH launch generates backlinks, initial awareness, and a permanent listing. Won't reach barbers directly but builds credibility and SEO value.

expected_outcome.conversion: 5-20 signups (mostly SaaS enthusiasts, not barbers — but reviews and feedback are valuable)
expected_outcome.timeline: 1 day of intense activity, long-tail backlink value
expected_outcome.compound_effect: PH badge on website adds credibility. 'Featured on Product Hunt' matters for early social proof.

distribution.cross_post: Share PH link on Reddit r/SaaS, Twitter, LinkedIn
distribution.notes: Time this for after you have 3-5 users so there's some social proof

content_suggestions.topic: 30-second video from your first paying customer: 'Why I switched to Timber'
content_suggestions.why_this: In a trust-driven market, one real barber saying 'this works' is worth more than all your marketing copy combined. This is the single most valuable content asset you can create.

expected_outcome.reach: Moderate as standalone — but used in every other channel (Facebook groups, Instagram, website, directory listings)
expected_outcome.conversion: High — social proof from a peer is the #1 conversion driver for barbers
expected_outcome.timeline: Can only produce this after exp_006 (first paying customer)
expected_outcome.compound_effect: This one video unlocks credibility across every channel

distribution.notes: Ask the barber to record on their phone in their shop — authentic > polished

anti_suggestions.why_not: Your site is a SPA — Google can't index it. Every blog post you write is invisible. Fix the architecture first.
Barbers are not on LinkedIn. Your ICP doesn't read LinkedIn articles about booking software.
Too much production effort for your stage. Short-form (<60 seconds) gets the same message across with 10% of the effort.
You have 1 user. An email newsletter with 1 subscriber is not a strategy.
Google penalises thin AI content. Barbers don't read blogs about booking software. And generic AI content won't differentiate you from the 50 other booking tools writing the same articles.
Too much effort for too little reach at this stage. Consider guesting on barber business podcasts instead of creating your own.

weeks_1_4.focus: Establish presence on Instagram and Facebook Groups
weeks_1_4.cadence: 3 Instagram Reels/week + 2 Facebook group value posts/week
weeks_1_4.goals: 100 Instagram followers, recognised name in 2 Facebook groups

weeks_5_8.focus: Product Hunt launch + comparison content + first testimonial
weeks_5_8.cadence: 3 Instagram Reels/week + 2 Facebook posts/week + PH launch
weeks_5_8.goals: PH featured, 1 video testimonial, comparison video created

weeks_9_12.focus: Scale what's working, cut what isn't
weeks_9_12.cadence: Adjust based on data — double down on highest-engagement format
weeks_9_12.goals: 300+ Instagram followers, 5+ inbound DMs from barbers, content library as sales asset
